title: search: should not look for id of current dataset if searching in ~/datalad
body:
```
(git)lena:~datalad/datalad-master[bf-asyncio-loop]git
$> ipython3   
/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py:936: UserWarning: Attempting to work in a virtualenv. If you encounter problems, please install IPython inside the virtualenv.
  warn("Attempting to work in a virtualenv. If you encounter problems, please "
Python 3.9.1 (default, Dec  8 2020, 07:51:42) 
Type 'copyright', 'credits' or 'license' for more information
IPython 7.19.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python. Type '?' for help.

In [1]: import datalad

In [2]: datalad.__version__
Out[2]: '0.13.7.dev716'

In [4]: import datalad.api as dl

In [5]: dl.search('haxby')
No DataLad dataset found at current location
Would you like to search the DataLad superdataset at '/home/yoh/datalad'? (choices: yes, no): yes

[INFO   ] Performing search using DataLad superdataset '/home/yoh/datalad' 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NoDatasetFound                            Traceback (most recent call last)
~/proj/datalad/datalad-master/datalad/metadata/search.py in __call__(query, dataset, force_reindex, max_nresults, mode, full_record, show_keys, show_query)
   1315             if ds.id is None:
-> 1316                 raise NoDatasetFound(
   1317                     "This does not seem to be a dataset (no DataLad dataset ID "

NoDatasetFound: This does not seem to be a dataset (no DataLad dataset ID found). 'datalad create --force /home/yoh/proj/datalad/datalad-master' can initialize this repository as a DataLad dataset

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
... <a flood of things>
```
so you can see above that it is searching not in the current (datalad repository) but in the `~/datalad`.  So that ds.id lookup is wrong.
